This method will be called whenever the player picks up a powerup that adds a new bullet to the Gun.
Game - Class in edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject
(@link Game) is the class that contains the entire program, where we combine our work to create our game as intended.

GameOverException - Exception in edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject
This exception will be called when the game ends by either the player finding the holocron, or by the player losing all his or her lives.
GameOverException() - Constructor for exception edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.GameOverException
This constructor will be called when the player loses all his or her lives, thus ending the game by defeat.
GameOverException(boolean) - Constructor for exception edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.GameOverException
This constructor will be called when the player finds the holocron, thus ending the game by victory.

Gun - Class in edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject
This class will generate a single object per game representing the player's single gun.
Gun() - Constructor for class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Gun
This method will create a Gun object and set the value of the integer ammo to 1; this constructor will be used at the start of a new game.
Gun(int) - Constructor for class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Gun
This special constructor will be used to create a Gun object after loading a game from saved data to set the value of the integer ammo to whatever value it was at when the game was saved.
GunTest - Class in edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.TestCases
This class will serve to test the behaviors of a Gun object to ensure it is working smoothly before it is used altogether with the rest of the game.
GunTest() - Constructor for class edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.TestCases.GunTest
